text: the children keep coming and America
just can't decide how to deal with the
surge of unaccompanied minors stopped at
the us-mexico border in the last year so
just who are these 58,000 children
sending shockwaves through US politics
okay
let's start with one key number one
hundred and seventeen percent that's the
increase of unaccompanied children 12
and younger caught at the us-mexico
border compared to the last fiscal year
now compare that to 12% which is the
increase in unaccompanied 13 to 17 year
olds over the same period so it's the
younger groups seeing really rapid
growth even though overall teen stop
number the young here's how the ages
break down so far in this fiscal year
this data all comes from the Pew
Research Center which analyzed
previously unreleased data from the US
government the numbers also show a big
rise in young girls caught at the border
a 77 percent increase since last year
boys have only seen an 8 percent
increase but again they still greatly
outnumber girls it's indoors that's
leading the way
sending 41% of all unaccompanied girls
apprehended at the u.s. border so it's
clearly a tough issue Obama has said
he'll take matters into his own hands if
Congress fails to act and among
Hispanics in the u.s. most do tend to
have more faith in Democrats
when it comes to immigration but this
time around
Obama is falling short most US Hispanics
now disapprove of the president's
response to these arriving children
David Booth BBC News Washington
